blocks.text: Directors of Lancaster Federal S. & L. Association, cook-out at the home of Bill Schmid...(1. to r., above) Al Witmer, Bill Logan, Kearney Snyder; Carl Herr, Don Gratz, Harold Smith, Clay Burkholder, Ray Longenecker, Bob Smith, Bill Schmid, Joe Byars, Earl Stauffer, Oliver Smith (photograph by Gordon).

June 21–22, 1971 – Gordon and Kitty drive Bill and Arline Robinson to Kennedy Airport for trip to Europe...proceed to Larchmont for night with John and Kathy. Sunday drive to hills of western Conn., especially to see Litchfield once again (with Kath).
At Kennedy Airport.
Litchfield, one of the most beautifull small towns in all New England.

blocks.text: Helen Buller and Kitty, ready for evening of bridge.

June 25–28, 1971 - Ernie and Laura Demi, from Sarasota, Fla., guests of Gordon and Kitty. Dinner and bridge (back row): Helen Krantz, Ernie, Laura, Frank Buller, Bill Krantz, Howard Ulrich; (front row) Virginia Ulrich, Helen Buller, Kitty.
Kittys brother-in-law octogenarian Roy Weaver in yard of his home on East King St.
On way to New England vacationation, Richard's parents, Dawson and Dorothy King, spend night with Gordon and Kitty (June 29).
Venerable Donegal Presbyterian Church is observing its 250th anniversary during the year 1971.

blocks.text: Gordon and Kitty drive to Philadelphia for Christmas Eve and to witness Blake's first awareness of the coming of Santa Claus.
Contrary to story, there is lots of activity putting gifts together 'till early morning.
"And all through the night not a creature was stirring... ..."
David's parents, with two other grandchildren, drop bye on Christmas Day.

blocks.text: Visitor from the far north, the Pine Siskin shows he has never learned to fear man.
The Evening Grosbeak, a fairly rare bird, comes to the feeder.
Goldfinch and Pine Siskin share the feeder.
The streams run clear.
Rural church that never got finished.

blocks.text: The Lion's Share RESTAURANT
April 15–16 – Gordon and Kitty make the first visit to new home of John & Kathy at 544 North St., in Greenwich, Conn. Rain during both days.
Jack and Mary Connolly treat to dinner, including Kevin and Rosemary, son and daughter-in-law.
David, Louise and Blake are home. Blake wears baseball hat, gift from Gordon.
Kitty goes all out to reach roadside plants for her garden.

CARSON'S GROC.

blocks.text: Thanksgiving, 1972. falls on November 23...

Thanksgiving, 1972, falls on November 23... Richard and Nancy, John and Kathy, David, Louise and Blake all home for a 20-lb. turkey dinner, which includes Aunt Mary and Uncle Jim. Departures Thursday evening thru Sunday morning.
Nancy, Blake, Kitty, Uncle Jim, Kathy and Louise.
Louise and Blake.

A special picture of Nancy,
birthday on the 24th.
Liz Hartman is dinner guest on Friday... presents Kathy and Nancy with examples of her handiwork.
Husbands in the T-V room,...John, Richard and David.
Headlines in December...

Mid-December finds Man again on the Moon,
perhaps for the last time in this century.
Ex-president Harry S. Truman dies at the age of 88 on the day after Christmas.

blocks.text: For the second straight year Gordon and Kitty drive to Philadelphia to be with David, Louise and Blake for Christmas Eve and a part of Christmas Day. Pictures show Blake hanging up his stocking; with a bowl of raisins for the reindeer; David and Louise with original Grant Wood from Gordon and Kitty; games on Christmas morning; reading from a new book; surrounded with presents.

Every one home after Christmas for a part of the holidays, Jerry and Cindy all the way from San Francisco. As the end of the year approaches, all four couples drive to Washington to celebrate the new year with Richard and Nancy. On Jan. 1 Jerry and Cindy fly to Jamaica or a vacation before returning to Calif.
Kitty greets Kathy & John (with pet), and Cindy & Jerry.
David, Kitty, Richard...
Cindy, Nancy, Louise.
Cindy shows Bill Lee the family history she did.
